citation.article-title: Reclassification of Streptococcus pluton (White) in a new genus Melissococcus, as Melissococcus pluton nom. rev.; comb. nov.

p.s: Melissococcus (Melissa Gr. n. bee; coccus Gr. n. berry)

The salient characters of the genus, based on the literature descriptions of 'Strep. pluton' (syn. 'B. pluton') (White 1912, 1920; Bailey 1957, 1963a,b, 1974; Bailey & Gibbs 1962; Glinski 1972a,b; Bailey & Collins 1982) and our own observations, are as follows.
Cellular morphology: chains of lanceolate cocci but may be pleomorphic and rod-like.
Gram positive (destains easily), non-sporeforming, non-acid-fast, non-motile.
No anaerobic growth without carbon dioxide.
Usually dissimilates glucose or fructose only.
Requires free cysteine or cystine additional to complex sources of organic nitrogen and other nutrients.
The cell wall peptidoglycan is based upon lysine.
The long-chain fatty acid composition is primarily straight-chain, monounsaturated (cis-vaccenic acid series) and cyclopropane ring acids.
The G+C content of DNA, determined by estimation of the melting point, is 29-30 mol %, G+C.
The type species is M. pluton.
